Token.Abstract: Delegate protocol for handling events from the swiper. Note that not all of these events are used by every hardware device type
This delegate function is called when a communication channel has been opened with the credit card terminal

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object communicating with the credit card terminal

Token.Abstract: This delegate function is called when the communication channel to the credit card terminal has been closed.

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the swiper that is reporting the end of communication

Token.Abstract: This delegate function is called when the connection to the swiper hardware fails to be created

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object that could not open the hardware communication

Token.Abstract: This delegate function is called when the communication channel to the credit card terminal could not be opened, but will be reattempted

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object that is continuing to attempt communication with the credit card terminal

Token.Abstract: This delegate function is called when an error has been detected when performing a requested task

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object that experienced the error

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: An error object with information on the error that occurred

Token.Abstract: This delegate function is called after the terminal has generated the Transaction Certificate or Application Authentication Cryptogram and no more online requests are pending.

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object that generated and processed the EMV request

Parameter.Name: response
Parameter.Abstract: The authorization response from the online processor, if any. If there was a reversal, this will be the result of the payment reversal

Token.Abstract: This delegate function is called when an attempt to make a payment failed with a non-authorization related error.

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object that attempted to perform the request

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the failed request so that it may be retried

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the error that caused the failure so that it can be properly handled

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called when the terminal is incapable of presenting the account type selection to the card holder. If this method is implemented then the delegate must call back the referencing object or the transaction will timeout

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Parameter.Name: accountTypes
Parameter.Abstract: An array of account types that the user must pick from (NSNumber -> WPYCardAccountType enumeration)

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called by some devices when the user confirms/rejects the transaction amount on the terminal hardware Miura devices do not call this method

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Parameter.Name: confirmed
Parameter.Abstract: A boolean indicating whether or not the user accepted the transaction amount

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called when the user keys in an amount when requested by the device This method is only called by certain devices that can display text and have a keypad

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Parameter.Name: amount
Parameter.Abstract: A decimal number representing the amount the user keyed in

Parameter.Name: currencyCode
Parameter.Abstract: The currency code of the keyed in amount

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called when the terminal sends a low battery status message

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Parameter.Name: batteryStatus
Parameter.Abstract: Indicates the battery status of the device

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called when the terminal is not configured to present the application options to the card holder directly When the hardware supports it, the terminal will manage application selection automatically (Miura for instance)

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Parameter.Name: applications
Parameter.Abstract: A list of the Application Labels for each application in the candidate list

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called when the terminal is not configured to request final transaction amount confirmation from the card holder directly This is typical on audiojack devices or other devices that have no keypad

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called when the terminal would like text displayed by the user. If the terminal is capable of displaying text (swiperCanDisplayText) and this method is implemented, then the terminal should be sent a text string to display to the user. This can be done via the completion handler, with a NIL string to have the terminal display default text.

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Parameter.Name: prompt
Parameter.Abstract: An enumeration representing the type of information that should be presented to the card holder

Parameter.Name: defaultText
Parameter.Abstract: The default text prompt the SDK will display

Parameter.Name: completion
Parameter.Abstract: A completion handler to call if the terminal is capable of displaying text. If not supported, a nil handler will be sent

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called when the terminal receives a card event. It does not return the card data and therefore is called in the event that the card data is not going to be returned for whatever reason. For instance, a card swipe does not return data if the card is IC capable and was swiped

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Parameter.Name: eventType
Parameter.Abstract: An enumeration representing the type of card event

Token.Abstract: This delegate method is called when the terminal receives card data and sends it to the secure vault to create a payment method.

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object that handled the request

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the payment method object returned by the server

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to any error objects returned in the request

Token.Abstract: This method is called when a bluetooth connection attempt is made and there may be one or more devices that are available to be paired with For Anywhere Commerce bluetooth devices this may return all devices within range

Parameter.Name: devices
Parameter.Abstract: A list of the names of all the devices visible

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the object making the request

Parameter.Name: completion
Parameter.Abstract: A completion handler that must be called with the index of the device that was selected by the user

Token.Abstract: This method is called when a key is pressed on a supported device (Miura). For EMV / PIN security, the key press will not be relayed to the delegate and therefore this message is only useful if the application cares about keypad presses for whatever reason.

Parameter.Name: swiper
Parameter.Abstract: A reference to the card terminal that is receiving the key press
